meanings.definition: To feel or show fear or apprehension
meanings.sent1: The little puppy was quailing at the sound of thunder.
meanings.sent2: She was quailing before the big exam, worried about failing.
meanings.sent3: The brave knight quailed at the sight of a tiny mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence quailed like a candle in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the forest made her heart quail with fear.

meanings.sent1: After the defeat, he was quailing about ever winning again.
meanings.sent2: She was quailing at the thought of giving up on her dream.
meanings.sent3: The team quailed at the idea of facing the undefeated champions.
meanings.sent4: His determination quailed like a flame in a strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism made her spirit quail momentarily.

meanings.definition: To cower or shrink back in fear
meanings.sent1: The mouse quailed in the corner as the cat approached.
meanings.sent2: She quailed in terror as the ghostly figure appeared before her.
meanings.sent3: The brave warrior quailed for a moment before charging into battle.
meanings.sent4: The tiny bird quailed under the shadow of the looming hawk.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise made the timid child quail and seek refuge.
